unnormalised: Preparations for Diwali usually begin weeks in advance. People start cleaning their homes, buying new clothes, and preparing traditional sweets like ladoos and barfi. Many businesses also offer special Diwali discounts and promotions starting from 15/10/2024, attracting a large number of shoppers. unnormalised: The five days of Diwali are marked by distinct rituals and celebrations. Dhanteras, observed two days before Diwali (30/10/2024), is considered auspicious for buying gold and silver. Naraka Chaturdashi, the day before Diwali (31/10/2024), commemorates Lord Krishna's victory over the demon Narakasura. The main Diwali day involves Lakshmi Puja, where devotees worship the Goddess of wealth and prosperity. Govardhan Puja, on the day after Diwali (02/11/2024), celebrates Lord Krishna's protection of the villagers of Vrindavan. Finally, Bhai Dooj (03/11/2024) strengthens the bond between brothers and sisters.

unnormalised: While the exact timings for Lakshmi Puja vary depending on the region, it typically takes place in the evening, between 6:00 PM and 8:00 PM IST.
